description: Two individual problem sets based on course materials, distributed in Weeks 2 and 7 with two weeks for completion each. Involves mathematical interpretation of galactic structure and cosmology tools.

Group analysis of astronomical survey data to measure galaxy parameters. Requires submission of a 10-minute video presentation with guided dataset analysis. Option to select between observational datasets.

Individual 5-page journal-style article analyzing datasets from the computational assignment to address extragalactic astrophysics problems. Emphasizes scientific communication and literature evaluation.

2-hour invigilated exam covering lecture content, featuring problems similar to those in problem sets. Tests interpretation of galactic structure, cosmological models, and critical evaluation of astrophysical hypotheses.
